dictionary.name: low
dictionary.description: Low severity rules should be used as part of correlations, or to support triage and enrich the analysis environment

dictionary.name: medium
dictionary.description: Medium severity rules will likely require tuning in an average environment

dictionary.name: high
dictionary.description: When high severity rules are triggered, an investigation/case should be created and completed with a high priority

dictionary.name: critical
dictionary.description: When critical severity rules are triggered, immediate action is required

dictionary.name: query
dictionary.description: A query can be defined as any rule that can be expected to require tuning in most environments

dictionary.name: alert
dictionary.description: An alert can be defined as a rule that in the majority of environments will cause a low false positive or true positive - benign rate

dictionary.name: campaign
dictionary.description: These rules would be tied to a specific campaign

dictionary.name: behavioral
dictionary.description: These rules are meant to identify behaviors that may match an adversary's behavior based on known reporting

dictionary.name: tool
dictionary.description: These rules identify the usage of a specific tool (offensive, or living off the land)

dictionary.name: generic
dictionary.description: These rules are meant to identify potential weaknesses in an environment

dictionary.name: exploit
dictionary.description: These are rules meant to identify the exploitation or probing of a vulnerability (e.g. CVE, General SQL-I / XSS Rules)

dictionary.name: ioc
dictionary.description: Rules that are created for urgent adversary activity that has little to no other detection measures (e.g. wannacry, notpetya, mass & urgent exploitation

dictionary.name: DRL 1.1
dictionary.description: The Detection Rule License (DRL) is a license for open-source detection logic as shared in

dictionary.name: audit
dictionary.description: How to enable log source audit

dictionary.name: enable
dictionary.description: How to enable log source audit
